intro: Tetrahitum, commonly known as the common tetrahitum, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in temperate regions and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its leaves are usually alternate and lanceolate, with serrated edges. Tetrahitum species are known for their ability to thrive in well-drained soils and their adaptability to various environmental conditions.
